snippet: A new federal database sheds light on payments made to doctors, but the health care industry says technical problems and inaccuracies limit its value to patients.
abstract: Federal database released as part of Affordable Care Act shows that pharmaceutical and device makers paid doctors $380 million in speaking and consulting fees during five-month period in 2013; in all, 4.4 million payments were made totaling $3.5 billion; data sheds light on murky financial ties between doctors and health care industry, but health care industry says technical problems and inaccuracies limit its value to patients.

byline.original: By KATIE THOMAS, AGUSTIN ARMENDARIZ and SARAH COHEN

lead_paragraph: A new federal database sheds light on payments made to doctors, but the health care industry says technical problems and inaccuracies limit its value to patients.

headline.main: Detailing Financial Links of Doctors and Drug Makers
headline.print_headline: Detailing Financial Links of Doctors and Drug Makers
